turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Move quickly. We are coming for you. We are in the Fortress.

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: I knew you would come.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Lyssa ...

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: Come quickly, Colwyn. I can see the eyes of the Beast.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: In the Arctic ice.

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: That way. I can feel the cold.

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: That's a better one.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: You'll both wait. At least for five hours. The wedding is at three.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: It was a platonic kiss, Father.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: Of course it was.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: They have Lyssa!

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: You can't reach her!  Through the door.  Quickly!

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: You will go alone.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I won't leave you here.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: You will do as I tell you. You will try to reach Ynyr, the old one.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I must follow the Slayers. They've taken Lyssa.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: You will not follow the Slayers, you will obey my command!  You have no chance alone, boy. You must try to break through to Ynyr. He has great knowledge. Only with his help can you save Lyssa.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: The White Castle has fallen.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Does the Queen live?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: The new Queen lives.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Turold's son was to marry her.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: We were married. Then she was taken by the Slayers. You must help me.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I have lived in this place, like my fathers before me, guarding the old knowledge. I knew, when I had no son, that the Great War would come in my time, and that I would be the one to pass on the old knowledge to a new king. Come.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: This is not the first time the Dark Ones have attacked our world. They came once before, a thousand years ago. A young king and queen, with extraordinary powers, were given to us then, to lead the struggle. My fore-father was their Councilor, as I will be yours.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I have no extraordinary powers.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Your powers are greater than you know.  Have you ever seen one of these?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: In the old books. It's called a glaive.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: With two or three days' practice, you'll be able to use it as well as I can. Then we'll have a chance of fighting our way out of here.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Two or three days! While Lyssa is in their hands?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: There is no other way.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: But there is another entrance to this place.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: But it opens onto the sheer wall of the Needle. There's no way down.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You have rope?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I am too old to climb down a rope.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You won't have to.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: There is nothing.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Reach out farther. Call to her.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Lyssa ... Lyssa ...

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You must break when the strain becomes too great, or you will harm yourself. And you must concentrate your powers for when they are needed most. What did she answer?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: She was in a great fortress, first in the mountains, then in the jungle. How is that possible?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is the Fortress of Krull. I know it only from the stories of wars on other worlds. They did not use it on our world in the first great war, for it costs them enormous power. This time they mean to conquer, at all costs.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: The Fortress moves?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes. Each dawn it rises in a different land: sometimes in the mountains, sometimes in the jungle, sometimes the desert, sometimes the sea. Never in the same place twice.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Then even if Lyssa tells us where she is, we'll never be able to reach her, for they will never allow the Fortress to rise near us.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: No. They occupy the Fortress, but they cannot control its movement. It is moved by Fate. And, sooner or later, Fate will place it near us.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Then we must be ready. Five leagues from here is the Eastern Tower. I know the Barons who hold it. Good men, and brave. They will help us.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You have not slept in two days.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Nor will I, till my bride is beside me.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You choose these?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Yes. They will be more help than high-born barons.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: They know when they're going to die?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Everyone of his race is born knowing the day of his death.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I can't reach her.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: What do you see?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Darkness. Tunnels and corridors.  Wait.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: She can't see out. She can't tell us where the Fortress is.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes, they knew of your first contact, so they drove her below.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: She was very faint. I was barely able to reach her.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The deeper she goes, the harder it is to contact her. Once she is below the second level, you will not be able to reach her at all.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I will find her!

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I cannot reach her.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: She is too deep. The curved tunnel we saw is part of the Vortex, the place of The Beast.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: The first time, when they attacked long ago, was The Beast here?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: No. Then they were led by his underlings. But I knew he had come this time, from the ferocity of their onslaught, from their use of The Fortress. They use up much of their strength to do these things. They are taking great risks.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: <u>Why</u>?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: But you suspect.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You will know, in good time.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: No. We will find another way to locate the Fortress.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: There is no other way. You asked me why the Beast had come this time.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: He has come for Lyssa.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Lyssa? <u>Why</u>?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Like you, she has extraordinary powers. He would make her his Queen.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Can she be forced?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: No. She must agree of her own free will.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You are young. You don't understand the attraction of great power, and you forget the pain of long waiting.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Then we must reach her before she feels that pain.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Traitor! She'll marry you in hell!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: He thinks you betray him with Lyssa.  Colwyn! The waters deceive you!

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I will melt that gold and pour it down your throat, old man!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: He sees betrayal everywhere. He will attack us so long as he is conscious.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: From here, I must go alone.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You will tell me her name and we will go together.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You must never know her name.  If more than one approaches, she will certainly kill them. Alone I may have a chance.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: He ran a great risk, helping us today. If he opposes his fate, his death will be terribly painful.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Let us wish him peace.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: They will hold Lyssa in the Center of the Vortex, the place of the Beast, where its power is greatest. No man can match it there. Lyssa must try to move toward us. For as we enter the Vortex and move closer ...

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: The Beast will kill her.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Yes. To keep her from you. But now that we are inside the Fortress, you will be able to contact her.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: She must make a glaive.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Lyssa, your bracelets. Bend them straight and cross them.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The spiral begins in the west.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Where the spiral begins.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: She's on the other side of this wall. I can feel it!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I chose the wrong passage.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: She can see the Beast!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Use your sword.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: What use is my sword? I can't reach her!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: Cut. <u>Cut</u>!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You must move quickly. The Beast will stop at nothing now.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You're coming with us.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is my fate to die in the Fortress.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: No! You cannot know that!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: I can. Because I choose it.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I forbid you!

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I found the body of the Seer in the stream.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Slayers!

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: We must enter the swamp.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Do not let the waters touch you.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: What will happen?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: They can be saddled.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You have done it?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I road them often in my youth.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Saddles.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: It is today?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Yes. It is today.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Each to his fate.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Each to his fate.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I know the cruelty of such a fate.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: Perhaps you think no man would return to me.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I don't think that.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: Am I not worth returning to?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: Am I not beautiful enough to be loved?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: Even by you?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: You too are lonely.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I ache with it.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: Let me comfort you.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I cannot take comfort when she has none.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: Then give me comfort. Sleep with me tonight.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I cannot betray my bride.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: One night is no betrayal. Have pity on me.  Please, I beg you, do not refuse me. You do not know the price.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I feel your pain, but I cannot betray her.

turns.speaker: VELLA
turns.text: You will not, then?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I cannot.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Help! Help! I'm drowning!

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I doubt it. The water is only an inch deep.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: It could have been quicksand! I might have been sucked to my death.  Where is this place?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: A forest near the Valley of Needles.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Blast! A thousand miles off course. Well, I was rushed. There was a certain difference of opinion concerning a venison pie. The foolish man left it sitting on his windowsill. What did he expect?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Perhaps he expected to eat it.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: For that rudeness, peasant lout, I am going to leave you hanging by your heels when I depart. Which is right now.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: I just remembered I have urgent business in this direction.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: What business?

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Staying alive.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Once is enough, thank you.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: He saved our lives.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Your kingship ... your lord high mightiness ... when I called you a ... a ... whatever I called you, I didn't realize that you were ... were ...

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I was hoping I might be your friend.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: My <u>friend</u>.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I have need of friends.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: No more, my lord - my friend. With Ergo the Magnificent by your side, your enemies are dead men.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Not yet, my friend. It's your tomato that's dying.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: <u>What</u>? Oh no! Better it was me. There isn't another good tomato within a hundred leagues.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Try your tricks on me and I'll turn myself back into a snake and bite you.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You and I will guard the fire.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: What else is left for a man without friends.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I don't think you'll grow careless.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Smart as well as quick. Now what do you have to give us?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Fame.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Fame?  Thank you, no. Fame is the burial ground of contentment. Eat it and go hungry; count it and go broke; seek it and grow mad. Fame is what fools yearn for and wise men shun.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Fame is what you leave to your sons.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: How did you know I had sons?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Because you would not rob if you had no children to provide for.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Hah! You don't know me, boy.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I know you.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: They stand at the edge of the grave and make jokes.  Do you know who I am, sprout? I am Torquil, Lord of the forest. My men follow no man but me, and I follow no man at all.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: You will follow me.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: And in the few seconds before I dice you to crow-food, tell me why I am going to follow you.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: So your sons will speak of you to your grandsons, and your grandsons to their grandsons.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: And where do you lead, boy?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: To the place where Death lives.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: It should be an interesting journey, then.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: That I promise you.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: I compel no man to follow me on this journey.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: When did you last sleep, boy?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: They burn many villages. Even walled cities fall to them.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Why do they burn the villages? There's nothing to gain.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I'm not hungry.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Not sleepy, either?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Forgive me. It's childish to cry.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Those are not child's tear. A child cries for himself, a man cries for those he loves.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Well, I'm not impressed.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I knew you would not be. That's why I chose you.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: You've eaten nothing.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: We must try to get horses.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Yes. It will double our range.  I know at least a dozen ways to get horses. All cheap.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: These we'll pay for.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Lad, you have an unnatural desire to pay for things. It stunts the mind and shrivels the imagination.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Hand over your dinner.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: A flicker of talent.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Forgive me, my friends. I saw terrible things.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: They do not exist, except in the waters of the Swamp, where they will remain.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Go, join them.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: What kind of friend do you think I am?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: The best. But my unhappiness is not made lighter by adding your's to it.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Well, it is true that if I received a royal command I couldn't very well disobey it, could I?

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Go. I command you.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Yes, my lord.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: We could reach it on fire-mares.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Those beasts cannot be saddled by mortal men.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: We must cover a hundred leagues before sunrise.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: At the gallop!

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: You're resourceful, my lad.  I tell you, one year under my tutelage and I could make you the Prince of Thieves.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Subject to the King, no doubt.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Naturally.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: A good thrust, my friend. Another second and there'd have been nothing between my head and shoulders but bad memories.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: I intend to keep you alive, your majesty. So you can abdicate your throne and become my Warlord.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Perhaps. If the pay is good.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: Make for the wall. I'll catch up.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Colwyn, don't be a fool. You can't do battle with that thing.

turns.speaker: COLWYN
turns.text: There's no way to outrun it. You know that. This is what Ynyr was preparing me for. It's what he died for.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Nothing worse than lower-class boors with upper-class morals.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Would you settle for a boar?

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: A <u>boar</u>? Those incompetent louts couldn't catch a piglet, much less a boar.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: You!

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: Me.  May I eat with you tonight?

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Tonight and every night, my friend, for this is the second time you've saved my life.  I am Ergo the Magnificent, short in stature, tall in power, etcetera, etcetera.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I am Quell.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: What is that awful looking place?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: The Swamp of Betrayal. Be glad we don't have to cross it.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: I'm glad.  I'm very glad.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: We'll meet you at the inn.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Can't I come, too?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: A venison pie as big as a house.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: A small house.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: And what do you think a small person lives in, you one-eyed fool? Leaving me here to mope while you and the boy were arranging my assassination.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Quell?

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: I cannot go with you, my friend.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: My heart stays here.

turns.speaker: CYCLOPS
turns.text: And mine goes with you.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Bread is for peasants, and wine makes me sneeze. Got any gumdrops?

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Sugarballs?

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: What kind of a boy are you? Boys always have candy.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: I have a cinnamon bar.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: You can have half.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: I am Ergo the Magnificent ...  ... short in stature ...  ... tall in power ...  ... narrow of purpose ...  ... wide of vision.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: I ...  ... am Titch.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Smart lad.  Bring me my spices!

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: If I could wish ...  ... for anything, I'd wish for a venison pie the size of a ...  ... mountain. No, that's too greedy. I'd settle for one the size of a house.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: I'd wish for a puppy.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: One puppy? Why not wish for a hundred?

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: I only want one.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: A foolish wish. And you, Quell?

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: Sir Ergo? ... My honorable Lord Ergo? ...

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: First, you desert me, and now you mock me. Go back to your one-eyed friend.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: What? Now you poke me in the nose as well?

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: I don't think it's working.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Not working? This nose? This nose works day and night. This nose has never loafed an hour in its life. This nose ...  What?  Impossible. This nose asleep while venison fills the air?  Where is it, boy? Tell me where it is and I forgive you everything.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: It's right behind you.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: We meant only to please you.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: And do you think I'm not going to eat myself to death this very night? Huh?

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Oh, she was so beautiful - and I was so <u>ugly</u>.

turns.speaker: TITCH
turns.text: Would you desert your friends?

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: No, no. I'm with you, boy.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: But also very young. Six to one is no odds, boy.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Get me down from here you louts or I'll turn you all into pigs!

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Put me down, you lout!

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: You had better manners as a pig.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: I am Ergo the Magnificent, and I do not travel with thieves and robbers.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: What are you doing with my dear? Stop! Thieves!

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Many villagers are hiding in the forest. They need food.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: And do you think I live on air?

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: We have plenty of hares.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Food for crows.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Surely a sorcerer of the sauce pan can make rabbit taste like venison.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: I am being exploited! Where are you going?

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: I must take the old man to see some sick children. Kegan will guard you.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Oh, my poor stew!

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Oh, my poor stomach.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Passable, pimple, very passable.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: The greatest boon of your otherwise worthless life, blockhead, is the privilege of dining on boar roasted by the hand of Ergo the Magnificent.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Your boast is a bigger mouthful than your roast, Magnificence.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: I can't hold the weight of both of you!

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Hush!

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Look at its beauty. Look at its grace.

turns.speaker: TORQUIL
turns.text: Look at its insides.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: No! Not yet! Let me hug it and kiss it a little.  Let me run my fingers over its lovely skin.  Let me climb to the top and sing to it.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: My spells always go wrong when I am observed. Be gone!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The forest is not safe these days. You'd best travel with us.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: <u>Me</u>? Travel with <u>you</u>? I am Ergo the Magnificent ...  ... short in stature ...  ... tall in power ...  ... narrow of purpose ...  ... wide of vision. And I do not travel with peasants and beggars. Goodbye!

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: One with red eyes, the other with one eye, both trying to kill me.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The one with red eyes was a Dark One, the other was a Cyclops, and it was not you he meant to kill.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: He was aiming a huge spear right at me!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: If that were so, you'd be dead now. He was aiming at the Dark One, for there is ancient hatred between them. Once his race had two eyes, like other men, until his forefathers bargained with the Dark Ones: they gave up one of their eyes in return for the power to see the future. But they were cheated, for the only future they were permitted to see was the time of their own death.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: He didn't join them. They joined him.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: And who is <u>he</u> that they should join <u>him</u>?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: He is the King.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: Well, at least I'm glad to see you have a sense of humor. That's the first smile I've seen on that gloomy face of your's ...  ... isn't it? It isn't. Oh no. Oh dear. Oh now I've gone and done it.

turns.speaker: ERGO
turns.text: They'll trample him to death!

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: No. He will master the leader.

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: I do not want your power. It is hideous.

turns.speaker: VOICE OF THE BEAST
turns.text: You know nothing of power, you foolish girl. You think power is a mighty sword, or a strong castle, or the paltry magic of an Emerald Seer. Power is none of these.

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: I do not want your worlds or your slaves.

turns.speaker: VOICE OF THE BEAST
turns.text: Then look!

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: It's a lie!

turns.speaker: VOICE OF THE BEAST
turns.text: These walls do not lie! He will betray you.

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: He will not!

turns.speaker: VOICE OF THE BEAST
turns.text: Then he will die!

turns.speaker: LYSSA
turns.text: He will come for me.

turns.speaker: VOICE OF THE BEAST
turns.text: He will not come. You will be my queen.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: What news from our friends?

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: Barak is still strong in the north, and Tendo holds the high passes. But the great desert forts have fallen.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Freylag's stronghold?

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: It has been taken, Freylag and all his people slaughtered.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: It is only a few weeks and already half our strong places have fallen.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: The attacks are unceasing: by night, the Dark Ones; by day, those of our people who have sold themselves to them, those traitors who are called the Slayers.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: It is the way of all invaders. Those they would conquer they divide, buying allies with promises of land and power.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: We will hold. Their power is not unlimited.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Lord Rowan is one of Lyssa's godfathers. He will defend her in the ceremony. I wish that Lord Modred were here. He is a godfather of her own blood.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: Modred has treated with the Dark Ones.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: For some, the lure of power is stronger than the ties of blood. No matter. I had hoped to have the wedding next spring, Lord Turold, with all the nobles of the kingdom in attendance. But Fate and this war have ordained otherwise.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: It is important to assure the succession.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: I will tell you something you did not know, Turold. Had it been my choice, all those years ago, I would have chosen you for my king. But my parents chose otherwise.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: I knew.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: You knew! You are a rude bumpkin!

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: That I am, my lady.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: A girl of some spirit, your daughter.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: A match for your son, I think.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: A fine match.

turns.speaker: QUEEN
turns.text: They will have the life that you and I might have had.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You were attacked in the forest?

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: Yes. We lost five.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: You were lucky. I lost thirty there.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: I tried to reach Ynyr, the old one. I led a hundred men to his place in Granite Needle, but it was surrounded. The Dark Ones guard it by night and by day they call out the Slayers. Ynyr cannot get out and no one can get in.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: How many did you lose?

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Sixty at the needle, another thirty in the forest. Only ten of us made it back.

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: We will have to try again. His knowledge is great. Without it, we cannot hope to win.

turns.speaker: ROWAN
turns.text: Modred! Impossible!

turns.speaker: TUROLD
turns.text: He leads a group of Slayers, under the leopard banner.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: We seek the Fortress of Krull.

turns.speaker: SEER
turns.text: Such a vision will be opposed. Who seeks it?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: The new King.

turns.speaker: SEER
turns.text: With an old voice?

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: You know the voice.

turns.speaker: SEER
turns.text: Yes. You have left your place in the Needle. It is the time, then.

turns.speaker: YNYR
turns.text: It is the time.

turns.speaker: SEER
turns.text: I will seek the Fortress for you.
